conclusion: The problem involves analyzing a graph to determine the speed of a car at a specific time. The slope of the line on the graph represents the speed.
The graph shows the position of a car as a function of time, with position (x) on the vertical axis and time (t) on the horizontal axis.
The graph depicts a straight line with a constant slope, starting at -2 seconds and extending beyond 0 seconds.
The slope of the line represents the speed of the car.
The slope is given by the change in position over the change in time.
From the graph, the slope of the line is 10 m/s.
Since the slope of the line is 10 m/s, this represents the speed of the car at any given time.
The car's speed is constant and equal to 10 m/s throughout the time interval.
The speed at the end of the 2nd second is also 10 m/s because the speed is constant.
The speed of the car at the end of the 2nd second is 10 m/s.
